question-text: Complete the following statements with appropriate words. Do not copy the statements.

set1.question-item-text: Maize is a tropical plant that prefers warm ---------- weather.
Transcription occurs in the ---------- of the cell.
Plasma is the ---------- part of the blood.
Drought stress or ---------- injury will likely cause damage on several types of plants.
The skull forms a protective bony ---------- around the brain.
Plants can respond to their ---------- in various ways.
A variety of human activities threatens the ---------- of Myanmar.
Humans obtain silk which is a continuous ---------- filament from the cocoon.
The two steps in protein synthesis are ---------- and translation.

set2.question-item-text: Wool is one of the most widely used animal ---------- and mainly harvested by shearing.
DNA ---------- is the making of an exact copy of the DNA molecule.
The contractions of the heart are called ----------.
The forebrain comprises the ----------, thalamus and hypothalamus in the brain.
A national park is an area set aside by a national government for the ---------- of the natural environment.
Coconut milk is a rich source of ----------.
A variety of human activities threatens the ---------- of Myanmar.
Biology is broadly divided into five major themes: organization, information, energy and matter, ---------- and evolution.
DNA is the hereditary material responsible for passing genetic ---------- from cell to cell and generation to generation.

set3.question-item-text: Fish farming or ---------- involves commercial breeding of fish.
Each DNA strand forms a backbone of alternating ---------- groups and sugars.
The major arteries close to the heart must withstand ---------- surges.
A plant disease is usually defined as ---------- growth and dysfunction of a plant.
A change in the environment which can be detected by the body is called ----------.
Seed banks have been set up to help conserve ---------- plant species.
Auxin initiates and promotes cell division in vasular ----------.
Wildlife ---------- directly affects the biodiversity of different ecosystems.
The genetic information is encoded in the ---------- of DNA.
The two steps in ---------- synthesis are transcription and translation.

set4.question-item-text: Biology is broadly divided into five major themes.
The blood and bone of animals are also used as ----------.
Rice is a ---------- food in many parts of the world.
Benefits of GM animals are increased higher ---------- yield in cows.
The dissolved mineral ions are transported in the ---------- thissue.
The study of plant diseases is called plant ----------.
Most cardiovascular disease starts with ---------- formation.
Coconut milk is a rich source of ----------.
The ---------- forms a protective bony armour around the brain.
Habitat destruction has played a key role in ----------.
